name: Fundamentals of Accounting
description: Course Description: Understanding of financial statements to support financial and managerial decision making.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: For nonbusiness majors. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Introduction to Financial Accounting
description: Course Description: Use of accounting information by decision makers; development of the basic accounting model, and issues concerning income and cash flows.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered as Mixed Face-to-Face or Online.

name: Accounting Professional Skills  Credit
description: Course Description: Survey of accounting profession career options, certifications, and professional skills.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 210.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Introduction to Managerial Accounting
description: Course Description: Use of accounting information in internal decision making.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 210.

name: Spreadsheet Applications in Accounting  Credit
description: Course Description: Use of spreadsheet-based applications to generate, manage, modify, and analyze accounting data.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 210 with a minimum grade of B- and ACT 211, may be taken concurrently and ACT 220 with a minimum grade of B-.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Intermediate Accounting I
description: Course Description: Preparation and analysis of financial statements under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP); accounting for revenue and assets.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (ACT 210 with a minimum grade of B-) and (ACT 211, may be taken concurrently and ACT 220 with a minimum grade of B-).

name: Intermediate Accounting II
description: Course Description: Equity structure of corporations; analysis and interpretation of accounting data.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 311 with a minimum grade of C and ACT 301, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Cost Management
description: Course Description: Utilizing budgetary and cost accounting information for planning, controlling, and decision-making.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  (ACT 220) and (STAT 204, may be taken concurrently or STAT 301, may be taken concurrently).
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Introduction to Taxation
description: Course Description: Introduction to U.S. taxation, with emphasis on federal income tax; impact of taxation on business decisions.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 220.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Accounting Information Systems
description: Course Description: Design, administration and control of accounting information systems; use of accounting systems software.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 220 and ACT 321.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Advanced Accounting
description: Course Description: Accounting for branches and subsidiaries, partnerships, and business combinations. Accounting for multi-national business transactions.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 312.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Auditing Practices
description: Course Description: Environment, professional standards, and practices involved in auditing financial statements and performance of other assurance services.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 312 and ACT 350.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Face-to-Face, Mixed Face-to-Face, or Online.

name: Internship
description: Course Description: Supervised work experience in public, industry, not-for-profit, or governmental accounting.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 311 and ACT 312 or ACT 311 and ACT 321 or ACT 311 and ACT 330 or ACT 311 and ACT 350 or ACT 312 and ACT 321 or ACT 312 and ACT 330 or ACT 312 and ACT 350 or ACT 321 and ACT 330 or ACT 321 and ACT 350 or ACT 330 and ACT 350.

name: Independent Study
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.

name: Group Study
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.

name: Research
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None.

name: Advanced Taxation of Business Entities
description: Course Description: Federal income tax principles and problems pertaining to corporations and flow-through entities.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Professional Ethics and Responsibilities
description: Course Description: Ethical practice of professional accounting.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 311.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Forensic Accounting and Fraud Auditing
description: Course Description: Professional practices for addressing the related areas of forensic accounting and fraud.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 441. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Accounting Information Technologies
description: Course Description: Best practices for information technologies used in accounting systems worldwide.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 350.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Consent of instructor can substitute for ACT 350 for a student with substantial and relevant work experience.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Legal and Regulatory Issues in Accounting
description: Course Description: Contracts, ownership, bankruptcy (debtor/creditor relationship), formation of business entities, regulation of accounting profession.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  BUS 205 or BUS 260.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Government and Nonprofit
description: Course Description: Theory and practical application of accounting principles and auditing standards to governmental entities and not-for-profit organizations.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 441, may be taken concurrently.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Oil and Gas Accounting
description: Course Description: Specialized financial accounting procedures related to the oil and gas industry.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 311.Term Offered: Spring.

name: A  Professional Practice: Taxation
description: Course Description: Management of professional tax practice; professional ethics and regulation; research techniques.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online, and in 8 week format. Credit not allowed for both ACT 601A and ACT 602.

name: B  Professional Practice: Accounting
description: Course Description: Management of professional accounting practice; professional ethics and regulation; and research techniques.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 441. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online, in 8 week format. Credit not allowed for both ACT 601B and ACT 602.

name: Accounting Research and Communication
description: Course Description: Management of professional accounting and tax practice; professional ethics and regulation; and auditing and tax research techniques.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330 and ACT 441. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Credit not allowed for both ACT 601A and ACT 602. Credit not allowed for both ACT 601B and ACT 602.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Accounting for Sustainable Enterprises
description: Course Description: A survey of financial, managerial, and sustainability accounting systems and reports.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Not available to Master of Accountancy students.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Accounting Analytics
description: Course Description: An examination of the tools and techniques that are necessary to complete professional accounting data analytics solutions.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 441. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Issues in Financial Reporting and Auditing
description: Course Description: Contemporary and emerging issues at the intersection of financial reporting and auditing.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 312. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Financial Statement Analysis and Valuation
description: Course Description: Tools and techniques of financial statement analysis and application to equity valuation.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 312. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Corporate Taxation
description: Course Description: Federal income tax principles pertaining to formation and operation of corporate entities.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Flow-Through Entities
description: Course Description: Federal income tax principles and problems pertaining to flow-through entities.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.

name: State and Local Taxation
description: Course Description: Tax planning and compliance issues for entities doing business in multi-jurisdictional locales.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Taxation of Corporations and Shareholders
description: Course Description: Federal income tax principles and problems relating to reorganization, consolidation, and termination of corporations.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.

name: Special Topics in Taxation
description: Course Description: Taxation of not-for-profit entities; international tax issues; other contemporary topics.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 330. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Information Systems Audit and Control
description: Course Description: Exploration of organizations' information systems, and the considerations involved in controlling and auditing these systems. Topics range from the general, such as organizational governance, to the very technical, for example, data encryption. Addresses material found on the CPA exam and the Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) exam.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  ACT 350 and ACT 441. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.

name: Independent Study
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.

name: Group Study
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
